Caption: Label on the album of the third convocation
Description: The third convocation of IIT Madras was held on the 30th July, 1966. The convocation took place on a Saturday evening at the Instituteâ€™s Open Air Theatre. A total of 305 students (203 B.Tech. degrees, 38 M.Sc. degrees and 64 M.Tech. degrees) received their degrees at the ceremony. Dr. A. L. Mudaliar (Padma Bhushan, Padma Vibhushan), the Chairman of the Board of Governors, presided over the ceremony. The chief guest and speaker at this event was Sir C. V. Raman, the Indian physicist, Nobel laureate and Bharat Ratna recipient.
